ratings.comment:
"The evaluation of your work is entirely based on what you bring to it and how 
I perceive it, rather than preconceptions regarding what you think you deserve."

Straight from the syllabus. If he likes your stuff you will pass, if not you will get deductions.
 
Hard to reach and bad at communication. Canvas page is badly formatted and confusing.

Professor Nardi is a good professor. He gives harsh feedback right away but that is only out of his own way of teaching. I would say, compared to other graphic design professors, he is the better one. All he really wants for his students is to try their best and think outside of the box. Go in with a good attitude, ready to learn, and you're fine.

IMPOSSIBLE to reach outside of class, which is ridiculous-- its an online class. Very negative feedback which is discouraging. Lots of quick turn around assignments. Unclear rubrics. Took the whole semester to grade everything. He's good at graphic design, but he just shouldn't be a professor, like most of the design profs. at Madison.

Loved Professor Nardi. He gives really great feedback and pushes you to think outside of the box. No quizzes, unlike previous years. Office hours were really useful. Didn't grade any of our projects until the last half of the semester which was a bit annoying, but he gives you time to resubmit your work for a higher grade if you want
Very fair and kind. He doesn't give much criticism, but that can be nice for an introductory class. Learned a lot.

Professor Nardi is the best professor ever! He wants you to succeed and he wants to help you. He's available at his office hours, or you can schedule an appointment with him. DO IT! Come to his office hours! He'll be there for you. Not an easy A, but a-very-possible-A. Show him that you a hard worker and you'll succeed!

I really enjoyed Professor Nardi's Art 346 class. He was a very, very fair grader especially coming from someone who has little experience in graphic design. As long as you try your best, show your design process, & make improvements to your projects you will do well. Some of the quizzes were tough but he offered extra credit to fix the poor grade

Henrique Nardi is a wonderful professor! He is understanding, attentive, and patient. He is adequate. It is easy to talk to him about your concerns in your design or grades. And he is always always always ready to help! Take advantage of his office hours. Let him know in advance if you have to miss a class, and you'll be okay.

The two quizzes in the class are extremely difficult and worthy 100 point. If you bomb one it doesn't matter how you do on projects you won't et back to an A in the class. He is very intimidating and hard to approach, the feed back is all negative and he grades extremely hard. The attendance is you can only miss one class.
